title: The Program
description: Set up your C++ environment and write your first program with basic output.

title: Hello World
description: Display messages in the console using cout.
hints: Use << endl to end the line.

title: Comments
description: Use comments to explain your code.
lessonExample:
// This is a comment
cout << "Code runs!" << endl;
startingCode:
// Write your comment here
cout << "" << endl;
hints: Comments are ignored by the compiler.

title: Basic Output
description: Print numbers and text to the console.

title: Variables
description: Declare and use variables to store data.

title: Data Types
description: Understand int, float, double, char, and bool.

title: Constants
description: Use const to create unchangeable variables.
lessonExample:
const int DAYS_IN_WEEK = 7;
cout << DAYS_IN_WEEK << endl;
startingCode:
const int DAYS_IN_WEEK = ;
cout << DAYS_IN_WEEK << endl;

title: Type Casting
description: Convert values from one type to another.

title: Arithmetic Operators
lessonExample:
int a = 5, b = 3;
cout << a + b << endl;

title: Comparison Operators
lessonExample:
int a = 5, b = 3;
cout << (a > b) << endl;
hints: cout prints 1 for true, 0 for false.

title: Logical Operators
lessonExample:
bool a = true, b = false;
cout << (a && b) << endl;
hints: Use && for AND, || for OR, ! for NOT.
cout prints 1 for true, 0 for false.

title: Assignment Operators
description: Use =, +=, -=, *=, /= to assign and update values.

title: If Statements
description: Control program flow using if statements.

title: Switch Case
description: Use switch to select one of many code paths.

title: For Loops
lessonExample: for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) cout << i << endl;
startingCode: for (int i = 0; i < ; i++) cout << i << endl;

title: While Loops
description: Repeat actions while a condition is true.

title: C++ Exam
description: Test your C++ knowledge covering all modules.
hints: Use variables, loops, conditionals, and functions.
